title: (x) Typophile home page - Mercury Display {Dav}
content: What is the font on the home page called? The typeface where the latest posts are put in this format “NAME: message.” Is it some font on every compuer that I don’t know about? I have never seen such a fine font on my computer. If it is free, where can one download it from?
author: Falak Shah

comments.content:
‘ [Mercury](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528001203/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/mercurydisplay/index.html)’ _( Display Roman )_, by Tobias Frere Jones..

_( It even says ‘Text set in 80px Mercury Display Roman from H&FJ’, on the [Typophile front page](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528001203/http:/www.typophile.com/).. :)_

You can see the credit at right angles on the home page, and can get the font at [www.typography.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528001203/http:/www.typography.com/)

Typophile’s Yves Peters says he soon will be reviewing this fine typeface, recently released to the general public, and four other excellent ones also influenced by Fleischmann, at [www.typographer.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528001203/http:/www.typographer.org/)
Ahh, I never saw it. (I have 800 x 600 screen resolution, and I don’t usually scroll to the end.) But I see it now. Thanks.
I wonder why it does not come with both lining/tabular numerals and OSF. I hope Yves addresses this.
